alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pleasants; Ritchie; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:41AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Meigs, Washington, eastern Morgan, eastern Athens, western Pleasants, northwestern Ritchie, northwestern Wirt, north central Jackson and Wood Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 539 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of McConnelsville to near Forked Run State Park. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, St. Marys, Beverly, Racine, Coolville, Chesterhill, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Williamstown, Belmont, Washington, Mineralwells, Tuppers Plains, Lubeck, Boaz, Newport, Chester, and North Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 157 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
